import React from "react"; import { Helmet, HelmetProvider } from "react-helmet-async"; import { Container } from "react-bootstrap"; import "../style.css"; import "./project.css"; const YouTubeUsabilityStudy = () => { return ( YouTube Usability Study | Portfolio

IAT432 Project: YouTube Creator Studio Usability Study

This comprehensive study was aimed at assessing and enhancing the usability of YouTube Creator Studio for a diverse range of users. By focusing on areas such as interaction, navigation, and cognitive challenges, the study addressed the needs of both frequent and casual YouTubers.

Project 1.1: Planning & Preparing the Test

Initial planning involved setting clear objectives, selecting diverse participants, and designing tasks that reflected typical actions on the platform, such as video uploading, managing metadata, interacting with analytics, creating playlists, and adding captions. Detailed task instructions, like the "Test Video by Participant [#]," aimed to reduce ambiguity, ensuring clarity and consistent user guidance.

Participants

The participant pool included both frequent and casual YouTubers to capture a broad spectrum of usability insights. This diversity allowed the study to address the interface's accessibility and usability across various levels of user experience, focusing on differing goals and interactions.

Study Goals and Task Design

The usability tasks included the following:

  • Upload a Video: This task measured user comfort with uploading, scheduling, and understanding metadata requirements.
  • Closed Captioning: Assessed the ease of adding and syncing captions, with specific tools like auto-sync.
  • Copyright Review: Evaluated users’ ability to navigate and understand copyright management functions.
  • Analyze Performance: Tested how users interpreted metrics and data within the analytics section.
  • Download Reports: Assessed users’ capability to export analytics data for offline analysis, focusing on report accessibility and navigation.

Observations and Findings

  • Cognitive Overload: Many users felt overwhelmed by the extensive data in analytics, particularly casual users who lacked familiarity with detailed metrics.
  • Ambiguous Terminology: Terms like "traffic source" and "click-through rate" were confusing to users with minimal experience, indicating a need for simpler language or in-platform explanations.
  • Feature Discoverability Issues: Some features were buried within multiple interface layers, leading to navigation challenges and reducing ease of use.

Project 1.2: Conducting the Test

Usability tests were conducted with participants performing a series of tasks. Observations focused on user interactions, instances of confusion, and areas where users requested help. Virtual and in-person sessions allowed for real-time observation of task completion, highlighting navigation and comprehension issues within the Creator Studio interface.

Data Collection and Observational Techniques

The data collection involved structured questionnaires and observational notes. Quantitative data measured ease of use, error rates, and task completion, while qualitative observations captured participant behaviors, such as misclicks, hesitation, and moments of confusion.

Key Challenges Identified

  • Complex Analytics Navigation: Users struggled to locate specific metrics and often required assistance to interpret data accurately.
  • Unclear Interactive Elements: Hover states and interactive features were not intuitive, leading to missed functionality and user frustration.
  • Frequent Misclicks and Hesitations: Unclear affordances resulted in misclicks and slow task progression, impacting overall user satisfaction.

Project 1.3: Reporting the Results

This phase focused on analyzing the usability data collected from the tests. A statistical analysis compared error rates, ease-of-use scores, and user feedback between the original interface and the redesigned prototype. Results indicated significant improvements in error reduction and ease of use with the prototype, suggesting that structured workflows enhance usability for YouTube Creator Studio.

Key Findings

  • Error Reduction: The prototype showed a statistically significant reduction in user errors, particularly in complex tasks involving analytics and captioning.
  • Improved Ease of Use: Participants rated the prototype easier to use, with a mean score of 1.54 compared to 2.85 for the original interface.
  • Guided Workflow Benefits: The step-by-step structure allowed users to complete tasks with less confusion and less need for external guidance.

Project 1.4: Prototyping Solutions

The prototype addressed specific usability challenges identified in previous phases. Focusing on both subtitling and analytics, the redesign aimed to simplify task completion through clearer guidance and more accessible features.

Prototype Enhancements

  • Guided Workflow for Subtitling: A structured step-by-step process included icons and descriptions, helping users understand each option more effectively and reducing errors.
  • Simplified Analytics Layout: Key metrics were highlighted to prioritize essential data, minimizing cognitive load and making navigation straightforward.
  • Tooltips for Clarity: Hoverable tooltips provided concise definitions, aiding users unfamiliar with analytics terminology.

Project 3: Controlled Studies

The final phase involved a controlled study comparing the original YouTube Subtitle Editor and the redesigned step-by-step prototype. The study aimed to validate if the structured Subtitle Editor would reduce user errors, improve task flow, and increase ease of use.

Methodology

  • Participants: The study included 26 participants, split equally between the original and redesigned Subtitle Editor versions.
  • Hypothesis: The structured subtitling workflow would reduce errors and improve task completion rates.
  • Testing Environment: Participants completed tasks in virtual and in-person settings, allowing real-time observations of their interactions with each interface version.

Data Collection

Pre-test and post-test questionnaires captured participants’ familiarity and ease of use ratings, while observational tracking provided insights into misclicks, confusion, and hint requests. This dual-method approach provided both quantitative and qualitative data for analysis.

Results

The controlled study found a significant reduction in hint requests, with users navigating the prototype more independently. Ease-of-use ratings also improved with the redesigned version, supporting the hypothesis that a structured, guided workflow facilitates better user navigation and reduces cognitive load.

Conclusion & Recommendations

  • Sequential Workflow: A structured task breakdown supports users by guiding them through each stage, helping them complete complex tasks with confidence.
  • Enhanced Tooltips: Tooltips reduced confusion, allowing users to understand complex terms through intuitive, accessible definitions.
  • Onboarding and Tutorial Options: Adding introductory guides for new users could facilitate a smoother entry into complex features like analytics and captioning.

Future Enhancements

Further improvements are recommended to enhance visual feedback and interactive clarity, ensuring that clickable elements are easy to identify. This refinement would create a more intuitive experience, catering to users with varied levels of familiarity with YouTube Creator Studio.

 ); }; export default YouTubeUsabilityStudy;
